attributes.action: Stop the mayor of London making Oxford Street a traffic free zone.
attributes.additional_details: How will disabled and elderly cope around London without transport? A majority of people rely on public transport. There is also so many tourist who visit London so everyone will rely on the tube which will then become to busy and uncomfortable to use.
attributes.background: The mayor of London wants to make Oxford Street a traffic free zone. I feel like this is a bad idea because it will make it very difficult for the public to travel. A lot of people use buses, taxis etc to travel through and from Oxford Street to different destinations around central London.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. The Mayor of London is accountable to the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
